website_summaries.verdict: It is a bargain, but it doesn't play nice with 64-bit Windows 7 and Windows 8.
pros: great price for the features included
cons: Struggles with latest Microsoft Windows operating systems

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drawing pad
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son and he really loves it. Be aware that the pen looks like you can open it to replace the nib, but if you DO open it, you break a connection inside it and the pen is then completely busted and has to be replaced--we learned this the hard way. DO NOT OPEN THE PEN. Not sure why it comes with replacement nibs because you really can't use them. But the tablet itself is really great and he's thrilled with it, and uses it all the time. I would recommend it wholeheartedly.
customer_reviews.author: iopele

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun tool bought for my daughter to use on her ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun tool bought for my daughter to use on her Mac. Unfortunately she did not read instructions and loaded software with unit plugged in. Now her Mac thinks it’s a keyboard and we haven’t been able to get the program removed so that it can be loaded properly. In her defense, the instructions are in a fold that makes following the steps confusing. I hooked it up to my PC and it works fine, but not something I will use. It does take a little bit of figuring out what app to have open to get going.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Charleston

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for I guess
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for the first few months but after that, it became difficult to use. After a while, I had to hold to wire in a very specific way to get it work. Once I got it working, the slightest movement would cause it to stop functioning. Sometimes when I did get it to work, the pressure wouldn't. I'd be spending half an hour unplugging and plugging the wire and restarting my computer to no avail. It's a huge pain to try to get it to work. When it does work, it's great! The pressure is good and works well but the amount of time I spend trying to even get this thing to work outweighs it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap for a reason
customer_reviews.text: The set up was awful, calibration was awful. When you actually got it to work it was fine enough, though the pen was cheap and I don't like that it runs on a battery.It didn't even make it a year, taking into account breaks for a few months between moving and life, so it maybe has 60-80 hours on it. And now the port to accept the cable crapped out, DESPITE always storing it in it's box or somewhere safe when not in use, which is what I would expect from my Bamboo tablet, which is almost 6 years old and still kicking. I wouldn't recommend it to my enemy.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Works, but only after a lot of work.
customer_reviews.text: The drivers on the CD included with this tablet don't work. However, since this is a re-branded Huion tablet, the solution is to simply download the drivers from Huion for the most similar 5x8" tablet they have available. The pressure sensing system also has problems - looking at the raw data, it appears that the pressure sensor is functional, but even after extensive online research, attempts at creating custom brushes, looking at code, and more, I still haven't managed to translate that into using the pressure sensitivity when making artwork.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, but not a Wacom
customer_reviews.text: If I hadn't been spoiled by Wacom and its battery-less pens, I'd love this tablet even more. I bought this tablet as a replacement for my 7-8 year old Wacom Intuos (what's now called an Intuos Pro), but I only used it for about a week before returning it for a small Intuos Pro. Quality-wise, there's nothing wrong with it... I love the sleek white color, and the tablet itself is very shiny and well built. It was just too different for me to adjust to, so I went back to my comfort brand. This tablet is great for artists on a budget. I even recommended it to a friend when she asked me for tablet recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: Misa

customer_reviews.title: might be a lemon but...
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to use this product but unfortunately never got to. I went to install the drivers and the cd it came with does not have appropriate files for my mac like it says it does. yes my mac is up to date and no the device was never plugged in. the files would not open as normal files. I'm a bit upset about it after reading so many great reviews. i wouldn't even attempt this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Loved the tablet, but the warranty is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good tablet to start out with. It's cheap and is of similar quality to the more expensive professional ones. The only problem I have with it is that the pen is flimsy and will break, but THE WARRANTY SUGGESTED TO BUY ALONG WITH THIS TABLET WILL NOT COVER IT. I called the warranty company to have my pen replaced and they told me that the pen was considered and accessory and accessories were not covered under the warranty even though the pen IS NOT an accessory because the tablet WILL NOT work without it and this tablet will only work with that specific pen. Please do not buy the warranty, it's a waste of $3.
customer_reviews.author: Mira Violet

customer_reviews.title: Great set up, great size, easy to install and start using.
customer_reviews.text: For the price the bang for buck is great, I do a ton of Photoshop editing and have owned 2 of the Wacom Tablets spening over 800 w both, After my last one gave out i decided to go cheaper route. These have paid for themselves easily. I even bought one to use for work too. Easy set up, plenty of space to work with. Ill continue to use this brand... Oh and i dont write reviews for compensation, Im honest based on my personal experience.
customer_reviews.author: T.O.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Decent for Beginners, Will Eventually Break
customer_reviews.text: This tablet lasted me two years before it broke (2012-2014). For the price, that wasn't a huge deal, but it was disappointing because it was only actively used a handful of times. Don't wrap your USB cables up or they will inevitably malfunction. I would suggest searching for some newer models from Huion in this price range before considering this model. Regardless, the drawing area was smooth, the pen nib lasted forever, and the pen holder had extra nibs inside.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley J.

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Windows 10 but still works
customer_reviews.text: You can download the drive for Windows 10, on their website, but the program isn't supported by Windows 10. And because that is the processer that I run on, I've had to toy around to see what all I can do with this as I like the design and wanted a tablet to submit my math work as I am an online college student majoring in math. So far, I've successfully used this on MS Word and MS OneNote. I'll update this review if I come across any more problems.
customer_reviews.author: Tiana

customer_reviews.title: my tablet of choice
customer_reviews.text: this tablet is the one I've been going to for quite a few years. It does the job, it makes the same quality art as other tablets, and it was all neatly packaged and didn't have anything missing!
customer_reviews.author: Sonny Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: Its got a nice big surface area and the sensitivity is wonderful. however my Pen's already got a crack in it from unscrewing and rescrewing the lid to save the battery life, and the USB plug in isn't that secure so sometimes it bugs out and I have to unplug and replug to get it to stop multi-clicking and spazzing. update: NOPE Don't bother with it. It keeps having issues every few months. I've had to replace the cord and the pen in 6 months and its acting up AGAIN. Cutting my losses and getting a tough Monoprice with hotkeys.
customer_reviews.author: Chyanime

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic tablet! My son wanted to get into doing ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tablet! My son wanted to get into doing digital art (so we weren't looking at making a huge initial investment). I read some reviews about this tablet that said it was one of the best tablets for the buck under $100. It definitely is. My son loves it. It was easy to install and use. This is highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dave M.

customer_reviews.title: Pass.
customer_reviews.text: I sent it back. Difficult to set up. terrible customer service. If you are going to use a tablet, spend a little more on it. I sent this back and purchased a Wacom Intuos 3 and am satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Bach

customer_reviews.title: a good drawing pad
customer_reviews.text: I like this drawing pad it works for what I wanted which was pretty much to mess around with it. I have still not figured out how to use the grey section next to the drawing area which I thought was used to set up shortcuts but it works great and I've been able to draw things in minutes that would have taken hours with a keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.author: Zan Montieth

customer_reviews.title: It seems like it's okay if you're buying it for your children ...
customer_reviews.text: I ended up having issues with the tablet and had to end up getting an Intuos. This tablet was very glitchy for me. You certainly get what you pay for. It seems like it's okay if you're buying it for your children to experiment with but I wouldn't recommend it for a serious artist.
customer_reviews.author: Brittini Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Best gift for a artist to be
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 12 years old and she loves to draw she has been drawing since she could hold a pencil ✏️.When we purchased this item she no longer holds the drawing pencils but she is creating beautiful art.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer a.

customer_reviews.title: Better than Wacom at a fraction of the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Wacom because I just could not spend that kind of money again. I actually find it BETTER than my $100+ tablet that was about half the size! I am recommending it to all of my other artist/graphic design/tech friends!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, but bad cord.
customer_reviews.text: At first. it was great. It worked smoothly and it ran amazingly, but there is one problem with mine. The cord. I have no idea whats wrong with mine but it can't keep a conncetion. At all. There is no damage or bends on the outside of the cord. Now it won't even connect. I took great care of it and kept it on top of my desk. I really like this tablet, but now I can't even use it. I was wondering if I could get a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Great for people not needing anything fancy!
customer_reviews.text: The installation process for the drivers was a little bit confusing, but I got pen pressure and everything working just fine after a little bit. Works well for the price, and is great if you're not looking for anything too fancy!
customer_reviews.author: NickTop Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Mid-range quality, budget price
customer_reviews.text: This is a budget tablet; there is no escaping that. It will not compete with a high-end Wacom, so it's not the kind of thing you want to buy for a professional graphic-design role, but that's not the point of it. Instead, this is a very strong mid-range graphics tablet for a fraction of the normal price. If you are a student, a webcomic artist or just someone who can't justify a high-end device, this will do the job and will do it well. The included software is basic, but includes most of the features you need to map the tablet to your monitor. All in all, it's an amazing tablet for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. Hart-jones

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Pen Tablet "Turcom 8x5"
customer_reviews.text: Good tablet to use with Windows. Not specifically for Mac - Download from site to add update on software. Has keyboard icon on bar to easily log in. That's kinda kool! On start up just click preferences from box. It applies automatically. Don't change stuff, unless your a pro. Has fluid responses. Good action. Pressure works good. I would recommend this product for serious beginners in arts.
customer_reviews.author: Don Robbins

customer_reviews.title: It's lasted a long time, unlike previous Wacom and ...
customer_reviews.text: It's lasted a long time, unlike previous Wacom and Aiptek tablets I've had that have had irreplacable pens that fall apart or tablets that become numb to input. Mostly I'm posting here for a link to the driver, because I keep needing to reinstall it with new computers and it's getting more and more difficult to get my hands on as this product gets older and less relevant.  (Windows 7)
customer_reviews.author: Hilary McConnell

customer_reviews.title: Worth it~
customer_reviews.text: I love this. To be honest, it's not very smooth and looks awkward when drawing on photoshop, it works perfectly fine. It's completely worth the price. I usually use $2000 tablets and even though this tablet isn't up to par with them, it's 2% of the price and 80% of the function. It's completely worth it as a first tablet. But if you're going to use this for professional or ambitious things, don't. Buy something expensive unless you're poor.

customer_reviews.title: MAC USERS, READ THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I've never bought a tablet before, but this works perfectly! Word of caution--it says that it works with certain macbooks, and it will say in the manual that in order to work this, you have to use the included CDRom ton install the software. I freaked out at first because I have the latest mac and I don't have a CDRom player. However, if you go to the website, they have the software available for download.
customer_reviews.author: Elanor

customer_reviews.title: BAD Stopped working within a month
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a Christmas present and within a month it stopped working. Of course it was the day after Amazons 30 day return policy ended. It will not power on at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Great price, nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Great, lightweight pad. The pen's buttons (calling for right-click or left-click menus) are a bit too high and easy for accidental pushes but the issue is easily solvable by turning buttons off in the system tray menu. Surface is large enough to resemble a standard letter sized sheet. Great for taking lecture notes and doodling!
customer_reviews.author: Andriy

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Well, for it's price I'm not surprised at it's length of life. After about 16 months it's crapped out on me. Will no longer respond to my computer. Possibly a driver issue, but even before this happened the cord became very unreliable. I'd be halfway through drawing a line and the connection would be lost, or it would reset and I would lose all pressure sensitivity. Other than that it's a good product. Sturdy and simple, came with enough extra nibs to last me for a while. The price has been reduced even further since I bought it so I'm actually considering just getting a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh

customer_reviews.title: ... looking at a screen then this little number is pretty neat. I might suggest propping it up at ...
customer_reviews.text: Once you get over the disconnect of drawing on a pad while looking at a screen then this little number is pretty neat. I might suggest propping it up at angle though to make it feel more natural while drawing but otherwise for the price this item is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: malcom

customer_reviews.title: Though the product does look pretty. The CD that came with it does not ...
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this in the mail, but for some reason I have just encountered problem after problem. Though the product does look pretty. The CD that came with it does not for at all, so I opted to fine the software online. Still not able to use the pen, and I bought it just for Photoshop, but I think I will have to return. I have already spent over four hours trying to deal with this problem, aint nobody got time for that.
customer_reviews.author: Camille Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: 5th grader loves to draw on the computer with this thing. I'll probably get one for me to edit documents at work.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after two years
customer_reviews.text: I had this for more than two years. I love the pen pressure and how it works for my paint tool sai but recently it doesn't respond the sensitivity in adobe products. The cords started to break and would only work in a certain position. Please save your money and buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: alma m garcia

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect substitute for a Wacom
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect substitute for a Wacom. It's small enough to take with me in my laptop case and is sensitive enough that you won't know the difference in a Wacom or this one. It DOES NOT have any programmable buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Richard2519

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: The tablet itself is alright, and the pen pressure was satisfactory, however the tablet stopped working only after a month and a half. I have been trying to contact Turcom for quite some time with no success. Honestly considering the fact my warranty for Turcom is still active as WELL as having purchased a 3 year warranty on top of that, it's truly ridiculous that I can't get this tablet replaced. Turcom needs serious work when it comes to their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is such a great tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great tablet for the price. It works wonderfully. It does not work with Paint Tool Sai like others have said, but it works perfectly with Fire Alpaca, MediBang Paint Pro, Photoshop, and other programs. My favorite feature is that it has a removable USB cord; very useful if anything happens to the wire. I previously owned a Wacom Bamboo tablet but the cord stopped working so I had to replace the entire tablet. I would highly recommend this tablet to beginners and those who like to make art as a hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointment. Should have been great.
customer_reviews.text: Touching your tablet with your pen causes it to right click. In order to move your cursor around without right clicking you have to hover over the tablet. They could at least give you the OPTION of changing the settings so that you can use it more like a mouse and have one of the buttons be the right click. Could be a much more useful tool with a little tweak to the control software.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Talbot Jr.

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Lighter than expected. No bad. Worth the price, nice gift for any aspiring graphic artists/ retouches etc out there.the green flashing can get annoying if you are by lights flickering because it turns on when the pen touches the pad, but its necessary for you to know if the tablet is working.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: It came a few days before delivery, i got this off a recommendation off a friend of mine. No issues, other then the power and off button was broken and stuck inside the pen when i received the package. Was a very annoyed that i had to buy a new pen basically spending 80+ (including the tablet) with shipping to use it Since they wouldn't send a new one to cover the damaged product. The tablet was great, the installation for the diver was fast and simple to understand . But i really liked it, i would definitely recommend this for anyone, especially someone who's looking for their first tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my very creative, and computer ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my very creative, and computer savvy, teenage son. He has been unable to install the software on his laptop and cannot use it!
customer_reviews.author: tomtom10

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. The only issue is that after a few days of it working perfectly, it started having trouble with Paint Tool SAI. The tablet pen won't function while the SAI window is open, if the tablet was plugged in before SAI was opened. As long as SAI is opened before the tablet is plugged in, it will work. Other than that, it seems like a good tablet for the price. There is a button on the back end of the tablet pen that seems like it should do something, but it doesn't move. I'm not sure what it's purpose is.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Haupt

customer_reviews.title: Overall, excellent tablet, but the pen is permanently on (will need to remove battery after each use)
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing with this tablet for an hour or so now, and I really like it! It works really well with Mypaint (once I fixed some known Mypaint bugs), and I've found it more or less intuitive to use so far. My one complaint is that the power button for the pen/stylus is broken, so it's permanently on. I can fix this by removing the batter after every use, but it's definitely more than a little annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Trisana

customer_reviews.title: Unknown Issue
customer_reviews.text: IIt came completely as stated, and when I plugged it into my laptop it blinked like it said and everything installed nicely. I have windows 7 and it says the device is working properly with no problems when I troubleshoot. However, it wont write? I tried replacing the battery to the pen and the nib and the settings, but nothing has helped. Does anyone know what the problem is or how I can fix it?
customer_reviews.author: 3b

customer_reviews.title: I love love love this tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this tablet! I draw often with my Macbook Pro, it works great. The price is amazing, it's really the best part. I've only had one problem, the pen is now a bit cracked between the grip and end, but I'm sure it's from me dropping it ect. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Great! Recommended for beginners
customer_reviews.text: i love this thing! ive had it for the past couple days ad it works great. I have used it for firealpaca and Photoshop. it works great as well when it comes to using it as a mouse. the tracking is a good inch above the pad than it doesnt track. the nibs are good aswell. its plastic and feels pretty good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jalen Irvin

customer_reviews.title: Okay I guess
customer_reviews.text: It works fine for the price, but whenever I go to draw something it'll randomly draw a line across the screen. I thought it was my hand laying on the drawing part, but I tested out just my theory a few times and found it wasn't the cause of the line. It's very annoying to have to undo your drawing every time a line randomly appears. Has anyone else had this problem because it's really starting to piss me off.
customer_reviews.author: lynn2011

customer_reviews.title: Bad Design, USB port breaks off inside case.
customer_reviews.text: Junk! USB port is barely soldered to the circuit board and breaks off almost immediately. Poor, Lazy engineering. Just Garbage. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Device!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and currently use this graphics tablet for digital art creations. Drawing with this tablet is amazing. I love it. It is very responsive to the pressure on the pen and accurately draws precisely what you want to. Much better than the expensive alternatives for graphics tablets, works just the same if not better. Plus, its not a device that will take a huge bite out of your wallet... love it!
customer_reviews.author: NatesGirl

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the first 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my wacom I had for 5 year. Worked great for the first 3 weeks. Started having issues around the edges of the tablet. Kept getting worse. Now it only works half the time. I usually have to restart my computer when it stops working completely.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted for 3 months.... The pen pressure constantly shut off. The usb broke 3 times. Finally the tablet stopped working even with new usb. I got a Wacom Bamboo that was $70 as a christmas gift and it worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: Tool for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Because this is relatively inexpensive, you should expect that it's not top quality. It suits it's purpose for me, as I use it sparingly for writing in podcasts. Anything more may be too much. It does not have a whiteboard type software that comes with it which is disappointing. Overall I'm happy I chose this product because it fits my needs quite well and has not broken.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: First Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is the first tablet I've ever owned, and nothing has gone wrong since it came to me. I use it at least once every day, and the amount of control has been fantastic. I actually recommended it to a couple of my other friends which is saying a lot for me. I wouldn't suggest it for anyone else if it didn't work as well as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Smith

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TABLET and it was the right price for a ...
customer_reviews.text: GREAT TABLET and it was the right price for a beginner like myself. It wasn't broken when I got it and it had REALLY easy installation, and worked fine with my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for starting out before you make a dive into the more expensive digitizers.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved it so much I got one for each of my kids... makes Adobe so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: ruthless

customer_reviews.title: A MUST BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I've bought in a long time. For the price and quality you can not pass this up. It has cut my editing time in half.
customer_reviews.author: BrinVlogs

customer_reviews.title: neat technology, good value
customer_reviews.text: my son loves it. using it with an hp envy laptop. he will tell you art is his worst subject so this device has empowered him.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Boncha

customer_reviews.title: oo bby
customer_reviews.text: Funny enough, this is the kind of tablet I needed. It was priced reasonably and very much doing what it's meant to do without being stingy. I got plenty of space to faff with and lots of spares. It has a bit of a faffy download first though... but nothing too complicated that you couldn't do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this tablet!
customer_reviews.text: So far the pen stopped working within 5 mins and the tablet has never worked. I'm hoping when I down load the drivers from the company website...that will fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Urban Writer

customer_reviews.title: but after I updated it works great!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work on my older version of Photoshop, but after I updated it works great!
customer_reviews.author: CustomConcern

customer_reviews.title: I was really excited to get this, but after ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this, but after I got it connected and installed the drivers and everything, it only worked for about five minutes before the pen somehow disconnected and the tablet refused to respond. Maybe I just got a defective unit, but I won't be trying again.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Barber

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 17 year old daughter for Christmas. She loves the tablet! She really likes the detail she can add to her drawings and how smooth the pen works. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but not crap
customer_reviews.text: An inexpensive tablet that works pretty reliably-- it doesn't come with any bells and whistles, but it does its job well. Best feature is the removable USB cord, since it can be replaced if broken.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet in the hopes of replacing my older one. When I first tried to plug it in, i has issues with the pen pressure sensitivity. I fixed this by completely uninstalling the driver that the tablet came with, downloaded a new one from their website, and rebooted my computer. Now i can draw with adequate space and impressive sensitivity!
customer_reviews.author: Mia Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Use it all the time; occasional connectivity issues but works well otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: Ixtaek

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Much Less than Name Brands
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my Tursion tablet for about a month now as a beginner to digital painting, and I would highly recommend this tablet to other hobbyists. I am pleased with the responsiveness and precision of this tablet. Given how much cheaper this tablet is compared to similar name brand models, I am surprised how well it works. I had no trouble installing the drivers from the cd on Windows 7. I also enjoy the stylish minimalist design, and find the size exactly right for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Burghard

customer_reviews.title: This tablet is working very well. It will not ...
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is working very well. It will not work with gimp 2.8 but does work with the other programs. It works with Photoshop programs and works with Krita. Krita is what I am using for digital painting.
customer_reviews.author: C. W. J

customer_reviews.title: Now that it can be used
customer_reviews.text: I had to wait until my laptop was repaired as this did not want to work on the desktop. It works great but one program is temperamental - one day it works the next it does not. But the kiddo is quite happy with it because it does not take as much room as the Intous4 & works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: evylone

customer_reviews.title: Much bigger than I expected, works AMAZINGLY. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Much bigger than I expected, works AMAZINGLY. The only complain is they don't tell you that you /have/ to turn it or the drawing is inverted. Though I'm blind, so that might be my fault.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney C

customer_reviews.title: Like at all
customer_reviews.text: So upset. It doesn't work with SAI, firstly. Like at all. And secondly, I can't get the pressure sensitivity to work and Photoshop can't recognize it.
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine

customer_reviews.title: I recommend first timers to try this out because it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Works decently for those getting used to drawing on a tablet. I recommend first timers to try this out because it is relatively cheap, and the last thing you would want to do is to buy a more expensive tablet, try drawing on the tablet and not draw on it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CD software wouldn't load
customer_reviews.text: Well, it looked beautiful, but the enclosed CD software wouldn't install properly. It would open and copy the .exe file onto your hard drive, but then when you run the .exe file it had an error message that said a certain file was missing. I went to the manufacturer website and downloaded the software, tried to install it, and got the same error message. So I just plugged the USB cord in and my computer searched for a driver, and it sort of worked, but there was no pressure sensitivity, you couldn't adjust any settings. Major bummer. (FYI, I have Windows Vista on my laptop). So, I returned the product to Amazon and got a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Ravenwood

customer_reviews.title: Just don't. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: It's a glorified trackpad. Run away and get a better tablet so you don't hate yourself a year down the line. It's cheap, but expect to want a new tablet after dealing with this for a month.
customer_reviews.author: Dingo Doggo

customer_reviews.title: The tablet was great for being so cheap
customer_reviews.text: The tablet was great for being so cheap.. It did it's job and to be honest.. felt no different than my 300$ intuos... However... the programming is absolutely annoying and glitchy that at points I could not use the tablet due to program errors. Good tablet to have as backup-/cheap replacement but not good if you need a reliable one.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: It goes haywire whenever I draw, it suddenly writes a zig zag or something like that Definitely not recommended if you don't mind pressing Ctrl + Z a lot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a GREAT deal!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for a VERY reasonable price. Works perfectly and shipping was quick. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The price is tempting but I'd recommend buying something else
customer_reviews.text: When my product arrived it wasn't working. I tried everything I could to get it to work. I had them send a replacement pen and that didn't work either. After that I received no further help. The price is tempting but I'd recommend buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: entirelyokay

customer_reviews.title: Good for a little while, but not very long.
customer_reviews.text: When I got this tablet, it worked just fine. It took some getting used to, but once I got the hang of it, I found it very easy to use. I've now had it a year, and last week it started malfunctioning. It's gotten to the point where I can hardly use it for five minutes without something messing up. Sometimes, you just get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it, this is my first drawing tablet so it was good enough for me!
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Very prompt delivery, and was packaged well. I highly recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Retro mom of Anime kids

customer_reviews.title: Scratchy, overpriced, not compatible.
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, the white version of the tablet has a more bulkier and scratchy sounding surface than the black, which is REALLY irritating. Now, my tablet doesn't even connect to any computer anymore, the on light just flashes on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Driver stops working
customer_reviews.text: I chose this tablet as a cheaper alternative for name brands and because It was recommended by others who have used it before hand. The product itself is stylish and works well but the software the is necessary for the product to work is a nightmare. The driver for this tablet stops working every couple days making me re-install the driver just to get the pressure sensitivity back. Its pretty frustrating but not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Gagin

customer_reviews.title: This is good
customer_reviews.text: but it didn't work on my paintoolsai. However, it works great on photoshop meaning it actually has the pen pressure, unlike with paint tool sai.
customer_reviews.author: Hoko

customer_reviews.title: very disappointing waste of money
customer_reviews.text: the cord connection broke on the third time of using. very disappointing waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: mg

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter and she gives it two thumbs up! Bought it as a replacement for exactly the same model. She liked the first one so much she wanted the same exact one!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Seymour

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing! I use it everyday for graphic design work, and just basic painting and drawing in Photoshop and it does it flawlessly. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to use it for editing in PS and the brush tool wouldnt work.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P. Ta

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes will lose connection making the pen not work but other than that it is a great product! Arrived in good condition and on time. Fun and easy to use, just need to get drawing software as well. Fantastic worth for it's price.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Drawing tablet
customer_reviews.text: purchased tablet for my Teenager who loves to draw. He loves the tablet, great gadget to have, good price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to Wacom!
customer_reviews.text: Having left my ancient Wacom graphire at home in my travels, I was looking for an economical replacement. I looked around and this seemed like the best bang for my buck. The product is amazing, I LOVE it. It's a beautiful white colour, and feels really nice. The installation took around 5 minutes and it was up and running, the pen pressure is great and I cannot be more happy. The only noticeable difference is the "springy" feel of the pen, as it "wiggles" a bit when you apply pressure. It's not really a bad thing, just different. But I definitely recommend this to any aspiring artist who can't afford a pricey tablet.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: we received this product promptly and it work's great,my daughter uses it all the time thank you
customer_reviews.author: Lauyana Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price though
customer_reviews.text: not as sensitive/precise as I had hoped. Not bad for the price though
customer_reviews.author: Ms H

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Nice product for the cost. Definitely not top of the line. Lines seem to be not as clean as the Wacom I currently own but it does have its perks. Overall good value for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: NocturnasNicole

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING! I love it so much
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING! I love it so much. probably the best thing I've ever bought, it works well and for the price its MORE than worth it.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory work
customer_reviews.text: Very simply I am happy with the product. Loading everything up was a bit of a hassle but well worth it. The pen is a little jittery at times, and will stop use temporarily if you use your keyboard or mouse. However, the performance is excellent and did exactly as I hoped it would. I would reccomend this to fellow artists, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rowena Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Drivers wonky with Win 10 and realy feels under powered
customer_reviews.author: Rarewein

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tablet for about a month, and I use it for digital art. It hasn't broken on me yet at all, and it works wonderfully and has less issues than my other tablet did (which would occasionally stop working and require a computer restart to fix). This one does not do that, so far, and I'm very happy with it. The touch sensitivity is incredible, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: ahhhhh it broke
customer_reviews.text: originally i liked it!!! it broke though so im really sad. it worked okay until it didnt at all, so now i have to buy a whole new one!! these are expensive, even these cheaper ones!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter it works great can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Angelique dalton

customer_reviews.title: I'm new to tablets in general, but I really like it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to tablets in general, but I really like it. It's simple, straightforward, and it's not complicated. Very good for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Cammerel

product_meta.title: Turcom 8" x 5" Pro Graphic Drawing Capture Pen and Touch Sensitive Tablet - Ergonomic - Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black

Give your artistic hand a powerful creative tool to draw with! The Turcom 8” x 5” Pro Graphic Drawing Capture Pen and Touch Sensitive Tablet Black is a drawing tablet that’s perfect for aspiring artists, amateur graphic designers or doodlers, and professional illustrators! It is an easy-to-use and affordable precision tool that can deliver high-quality output. It is also ideal for whiteboard demonstrations, document annotation, freehand illustration, and publishing software. This drawing tablet is designed to mimic the experience of sketching with a traditional pen and paper.

An 8” by 5” drawing space allows you to cover varying sizes of illustrations, from large to small. WIth a resolution (LPI) of 4000, a report rate speed (RPS) of 200, and a pressure sensitivity level of 1024, furthermore, the screen is able to give you spectacular results. The wireless pen has a pressure sensitivity level of 2048, which is great for graphic artists and illustrators who desire to acquire precise cursor control in drawing accurately while reducing the chance of RSI or repetitive strain injuries. Suitable for vector, comic book, and manga drawing and illustrations that use flat coloring, the pen has a balanced weight and offers a seamless integration of technology with your own hands. It only requires a single AAA battery, which is included in the package.

This drawing tool is manufactured with a sleek and ergonomic design that is neither too big nor too small—making it the perfect size for convenient drawing and ideal to fit in most desk drawers for safekeeping.

The Turcom Graphic Drawing Tablet is compatible with Windows 2000, Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, and Mac OS Z 10.3.5 and above (including Snow Leopard). It’s also easy to install just by carefully following the instructions. Create great works of art without the need for expensive art materials with this high-tech drawing tablet.
feature_bullets: NATURAL FEEL OF PEN ON PAPER - Look no further for a drawing tablet that will make editing digital photos, painting, and drawing much easier! The Turcom 8" x 5" Pro Graphic Drawing Capture Pen and Touch-Sensitive Tablet is ideal for whiteboard demonstrations, document annotation, free-hand illustration, and publishing software. Its functionality is as convenient as drawing on smooth paper with a pen.

8" X 5" DRAWING AREA - This product features a drawing space of 8" by 5" that will allow you to cover varying sizes of illustrations, from large to small. With a resolution (LPI) of 4000, a report rate speed (RPS) of 200, and a pressure sensitivity level of 1024, this precision tool is perfect for everyone from aspiring kids to professional artists and will deliver the quality of illustration that you want to achieve.

BUILT WITH PRECISION AND SMART TECHNOLOGY - The pen has a pressure sensitivity level of 2048 that is great for graphic artists and illustrators who desire to acquire precise cursor control in drawing accurately while reducing the chance of RSI or repetitive strain injuries. This is also suitable for vector or anime drawing and illustrations that use flat coloring.

WIRELESS PEN AND SLEEK DESIGN - Though the tablet itself is wired to allow it to connect to your personal computer, the TS-6580 pen is wireless, giving the artist a balanced weight and the seamless integration of technology with their own hands. The pen has many functions and only requires one AAA battery (included in the package). Additionally, the tablet's sleek, ergonomic design is neither too big nor too small. It will perfectly fit in most desk drawers for convenience and safekeeping.

COMPATIBILITY AND EASY INSTALLATION - The Turcom 8" x 5" Pro Graphic Drawing Tablet is compatible with Windows 2000, Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, and Mac OS Z 10.3.5 and above (including Snow Leopard). An instruction manual is provided for simple installation and usage.
